result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melyssa A Cowan

defendant.name: Cowan, Melyssa A
defendant.address: 3552 E Tesch Ave #2, Saint Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Melyssa A Cowan not in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Melyssa A Cowan not in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear she has another case 22CM1296 that is scheduled for a initial appearance on 6/8/2022, at 1:00 p.m. This case will be rescheduled to that same court date. If she fails to appear at the next court appearance warrants will be issued on both cases.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/24/2022@1:30p
